RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 22200. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $9,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Les s Not Considered In Eligibility) (*Plus Up To $810 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KHOZZY VALINTINE was unhurried early, raced evenly from the inside on the turn and with a bid in mid stretch proved best. SNELL FLICKA set the pace, had the lead on the turn and vied from the four path at the top of the stretch but was outgunned. J M R GEMMA was in range and roused on the turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch was outfinished. REMEMBEROLDTYMES was away alertly and a factor on the turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch leveled off. PACENZA was in touch and saved ground on the turn but had no impact. CRUMLIN BIRD was off the pace and hustled along on the turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Khozzy Valintine
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, evenly inside turn, bid stretch, proved best

ENTRY.NAME: Crumlin Bird
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, hustled along turn, 5-path stretch, not a factor

ENTRY.NAME: Snell Flicka
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, led turn, vied 4-path stretch, outgunned

ENTRY.NAME: Rememberoldtymes
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, factor turn, 5-path stretch, leveled off

ENTRY.NAME: Pacenza
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, saved ground turn, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: J M R Gemma
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, roused turn, 6-path stretch, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 15750. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility) (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: A I INITIATIVE was well back, closed the gap on the far turn and with a bid in mid stretch drew clear. HIATUS set the pace, had a slim lead on the far turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch held place. THELONIOUS stalked the early leader and forced the pace on the far turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch was outfinished. LOQUACIOUS was off the pace and had a mild gain on the far turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch needed more. FEELING was in touch early but lost ground on the far turn and was empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Feeling
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch early, lost ground far turn, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Thelonious
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, forced pace far turn, 5-path stretch, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Hiatus
ENTRY.OWNER: Voyce Jeff and McGirr Jr Herbert
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, slim lead far turn, 4-path stretch, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Loquacious
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, mild gain far turn, 6-path stretch, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: A I Initiative
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, closed gap far turn, bid mid stretch, drew clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 15750. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility) (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REIGN BY REIN was away alertly, a factor on the turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch fought gamely for the win. IS THERE A FOREST set the pace, had a clear lead on the turn and vied through the stretch but was second best. ORBITING THE SKY was off the pace, moved up on the turn, angled out in mid stretch and finished well. FANCYSOUL was in touch and raced evenly on the turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch was no real threat. ROAD MAP was unhurried early and saved ground on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch had no rally. LETS RUN TWO stalked the early leader and had a good position on the turn but weakened through the stretch. SUBZERO PLUS had no speed and was hustled along on the turn but from the eight path at the top of the stretch failed to fire.

ENTRY.NAME: Road Map
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, saved ground turn, 4-path stretch, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Subzero Plus
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, hustled along turn, 8-path stretch, failed to fire

ENTRY.NAME: Orbiting the Sky
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, moved up turn, angled out stretch, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Is There a Forest
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, clear lead turn, vied stretch, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Fancysoul
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, evenly urn, 6-path stretch, no real threat

ENTRY.NAME: Lets Run Two
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, good position turn, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Reign by Rein
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, factor turn, 5-path stretch, fought gamely

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 13500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Award s).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BEN LOMOND tracked the early leader, was a factor on the turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch drew off. JAMAICAN JIMMY was hustled early and had the lead on the turn but was headed in mid stretch and gave way. COO BIRD was off the pace and moved up on the turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch was all out. BE THE CHANGE was in touch and roused on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch had no response. LETTING LOOSE was unhurried early and had a mild gain on the turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch was no real threat. RADCLIFFE was in range but chased on the turn and from the six path at the top of the stretch failed to fire. ONE PUNCH CHARLIE was settled off the pace and hustled along on the turn but from the seven path at the top of the stretch had no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Jamaican Jimmy
ENTRY.OWNER: Vonkalckreuth Bart Alexander Langelaan Casey F Blair Guy Robert Fournier Mark Le
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, led turn, headed mid stretch, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Be the Change
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, roused turn, 4-path stretch, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Coo Bird
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, moved up turn, 3-path stretch, all out

ENTRY.NAME: Ben Lomond
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leader, factor turn, 4-path stretch, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Letting Loose
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, mild gain turn, 5-path stretch, no real threat

ENTRY.NAME: Radcliffe
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, chased turn, 6-path stretch, failed to fire

ENTRY.NAME: One Punch Charlie
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, hustled along turn, 7-path stretch, no impact

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 5 5F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 15750. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility) (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOUEMMA was unhurried early, had a mild gain from the inside on the turn, angled outside in mid stretch and got up in time. SHELLY THE ROCKET was in range, roused from between foes on the turn and took the lead from the five path in mid stretch but was caught late. SHANGHAI KIMMY was in touch, raced evenly on the turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch was up for show. JUNGLE GODDESS forced the early pace and dueled on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch had nothing left. EASY ACCESS set a pressured pace, had a slim lead on the turn and vied to mid stretch but gave way. FUN COOL was off slow and hustled along on the turn but from the seven path at the top of the stretch was no threat. BETTABE SWIFT reared at the start and showed little while outrun. A STEWARDS' INQUIRY INTO THE START LEFT THE RESULTS AS POSTED.

ENTRY.NAME: Easy Access
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, slim lead turn, vied to mid stretch, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Shanghai Kimmy
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, evenly turn, 3-path stretch, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Shelly the Rocket
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, roused between turn, led 5-path stretch, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Jungle Goddess
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced pace, dueled turn, 4-path stretch, nothing left

ENTRY.NAME: Louemma
ENTRY.OWNER: Ascot Stud Willwerth James and Stocker-Parks Rachel
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, mild gain turn, angled out mid stretch, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Fun Cool
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, hustled along turn, 7-path stretch, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Bettabe Swift
ENTRY.COMMENT: reared start, showed little, outrun

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 6 7F Turf CR: 69. Claiming Purse 19800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 5 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(Limited To 10 Starters)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards). If deemed inadvisable by management to run on the turf, this race will be run at a distance of Six and One Half Furlongs on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KODIAK MAMBA (IRE) tracked the early leaders, was a factor on the far turn and from the 4-path at the top of the stretch proved best. SOUP SPOON set a pressured pace, had a slim lead on the far turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch was second best. QUIET REBEL was unhurried early, moved up on the far turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch was up for show. SILENT WARNING forced the early pace and dueled on the far turn but leveled off late. UNBRIDLED INFERNO was off the pace, saved ground on the far turn and finished well. IRIE ISLAND MAN was in mid pack and roused from between foes on the far turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch had no response. DYNAMIC MISSION was well back and hustled along on the far turn but from the seven path at the top of the stretch had no rally.

ENTRY.NAME: Dynamic Mission
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, hustled along far turn, 7-path stretch, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Unbridled Inferno
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, saved ground far turn, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Kodiak Mamba (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, factor far turn, 4-path stretch, proved best

ENTRY.NAME: Silent Warning
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced pace, dueled far turn, leveled off late

ENTRY.NAME: Soup Spoon
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, slim lead far turn, 3-path stretch, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Quiet Rebel
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, moved up far turn, 5-path stretch, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Irie Island Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, roused between far turn, 6-path stretch, no response
